Name: Mirror of Queen Ahhotep
Description: The thick gold oval disk and golden reflective surface of this mirror are attached to a sturdy handle by means of a rivet. Two Hathor faces placed back-to-back separate the flower cluster from the shaft. Each face is triangular and has the usual cow's ears and fringe of hair on the forehead. Below the head are the ties of the column shaft. The column in the shape of a papyrus was the most popular shape for Egyptian mirror handles and the flower cluster with slender stalks is common in this period.
